original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at Rs305/306 to US dollar, bond yields down
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee opened at 305/306 to the US dollar on Monday, dealers said, while bond yields were down.
The Spot US dollar closed at 304.00/36.00 rupees on Friday after interventions around 314 to the US dollar and moral suasion, market participants said.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 22.90/23.10 percent, down from 23.00/10 percent a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 24.75/25.25 percent, down from the previous day’s close at 24.90/25.10 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 closed at 26.90/27.10 percent. steady from 27.00/25 percent.
A six-months bill was quoted at 19.25/20.25 percent.  (Colombo/ June 19/2023)
